title: Vinesh Phogat Stands Firm:  Wrestler Says Protest Will Continue Until Accused WFI Chief is Arrested
content:
Olympic medalist Vinesh Phogat has penned a powerful opinion piece, reiterating her commitment to the ongoing protest against Wrestling Federation of India (WFI) chief Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, accused of sexual harassment. 

Phogat, along with other top wrestlers, has been staging a sit-in at Jantar Mantar for over a month, demanding Singh's arrest.  Despite the challenges and the impact on their training, the wrestlers are unwavering in their pursuit of justice.

Phogat's article highlights the systemic issues within Indian wrestling, where athletes feel powerless against those in positions of authority.  She calls out the lack of support from the Sports Ministry and the Oversight Committee, emphasizing the need for a complete overhaul of the federation's culture and leadership.
author: Scroll Staff
